pros: Interacting with students is usually fun, especially meeting students from other companies.
cons: Absolute crap pay, the college doesn't seem to have a strong direction, and the compensation is bad compared to neighboring colleges

pros: Missouri Valley's community is welcoming and make you feel like home. It's a good place to start and earn experience for your career. Great opportunity to network, learn about new cultures, and get in contact with people from all over the world. The college has high growth potential.
cons: Low pay. The town is small and underdeveloped.

pros: Monday - Friday work week. Day Shift with most major holidays off. Great group of people to work with.
The people in the actual admissions office are great!
cons: The pay is terrible and lots of workplace gossip between offices.

pros: A lot of ethnicities working in the environment
cons: Internationals are only allowed to work at the cafeteria

review_title: A potentially good school crippled by poor leadership
pros: OK, let's face it - students who can get into other schools don't come here. Having said that, there is a lot that could be done for these students if the administration would stop pressuring faculty to pass students on sports teams. No, your next brain surgeon is unlikely to be a Valley Alumni, but there are a lot of potentially good students here with potential. Staff is generally congenial and supportive, and the money wouldn't be so bad if the administration was halfway competent.
cons: Sports and sports scholarships are the "business model" of Missouri Valley College. Not much else matters, particularly in the educational arena. Staff and faculty are fired on the president's whim even while others take off 2 weeks in the middle of the semester with no notice and are retained. If you work here, don't get too comfortable (unless you're related somehow to the president or her husband), and don't delude yourself that education matters to anyone but yourself.

pros: Not a lot of micromanagement from administration (but then, not a lot of management from administration, either).
cons: Those who have noted the low compensation are being generous in their comments.  In every faculty salary-comparison for mid-MO colleges and universities I've seen (which is many, over a period of a decade), MVC consistently ranks at the very bottom--not close to the bottom, but AT the bottom, and usually by a fair bit.  This, combined with refusal to consider moving to the tenure system, is a morale-killer for faculty.  It chased me away and has done that for others.  It is beyond bewildering that admin. doesn't consider this an issue worth addressing.

pros: Each office here is a little different, but overall, working at MVC is like working with a family. Everyone has its good days and bad days but in the end everyone is there for each other.
cons: There is not a lot of room for advancement. Offices are small in size that allows for one or two promotions, but that is it.

review_title: Great Place to work! Great people who are always helpful!
job_title: Day Care Assistant in Marshall, MO
pros: Missouri Valley college has that great small town feel. It is located in a a great town. Everyone is very friendly and super helpful. They are very flexible and easy to work with.
cons: If you are not accustom to the small town atmosphere you might not like it here. Everyone knows everyone and everything that is happening. Sometime people know more about you then you do.

pros: Easy on hand training great benifits job certs. And equal opportunities and great co workers all ways looking put for each other on the job and off
cons: Lots of traveling and long period a away from home travel or relocation is mandatory travel pay and relocation reembirsment are standard

pros: Small classes, one on one teaching ,diversified community, really good environment for freshman and for the students who are playing sports
cons: Don't help you to find a job there is no job fair on campus on any database that can help you find a job or get hired out of college

pros: MVC is not very big and it brings a very good community-orientated atmosphere.
cons: MVC does not appreciate its staff as much as they should do.
